    Personalized Recommendation

    Everyone is unique and we're here to learn about your needs and preferences. Prefer cheap but risky insurance? Have a favorite doctor? We got you covered.

    Visualize All Your Options

    Don't like our recommendation? No worries! Besides showing other suitable plans, HoneyInsured lets you view your whole shebang of options.

    Simple Explanations

    No complex terms. We will explain your plan in human language.

    5-min Enrollment

    Unlike HealthCare.gov, we optimized the process and only ask the necessary questions. It'll be even shorter if you don't need subsidies!

    You deserve only the best health insurance.

    At HoneyInsured, we do the hard research to find you that.

    100% Research and Data-Driven

    HoneyInsured is built with data from the ground up. Our recommendation engine puts dozens of federal, state, and insurance company databases at your fingertips – so you can make the optimal decision and get the sweet, affordable healthcare you deserve.

    We even try to improve healthcare from within - by informing government policies through our research. Our latest research published by Harvard University finds that the largest insurance carriers in each state raised rates much more than other carriers from ’14 to ’15. Find out how you would be affected.

      This website is operated by CortexML Inc. DBA HoneyInsured Insurance Services and is not the Health Insurance Marketplace website. In offering this website, HoneyInsured is required to comply with all applicable federal law, including the standards established under 45 C.F.R. 155.220(c) and (d) and standards established under 45 C.F.R. 155.260 to protect the privacy and security of personally identifiable information. This website may not display all data on Qualified Health Plans being offered in your state through the Health Insurance Marketplace website. To see all available data on Qualified Health Plan options in your state, go to Health Insurance Marketplace website at HealthCare.gov.
